name: aws-dynamodb
label: AWS DynamoDB
description: AWS DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. This connector facilitates the automate operations related to manage database table, data and backup.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.tooltip: Select the Configuration Type from IAM Role or Access Credentials. The selected configuration type determines the type of credentials that you require to access AWS DynamoDB and perform automated actions.
fields.description:
Select the Configuration Type from IAM Role or Access Credentials. The selected configuration type determines the type of credentials that you require to access AWS DynamoDB and perform automated actions. Enter the requested details as per the following:  

IAM Role  

AWS Instance IAM Role: Specify the IAM Role of your AWS instance that you need to access the AWS DynamoDB service. 

Access Credentials  

AWS Region: Specify the AWS region of your account required to access the AWS DynamoDB service. 

AWS Access Key ID: Specify the AWS Access Key's ID required to access the AWS DynamoDB service. 

AWS Secret Access Key: Specify the AWS Secret Access Key required to access the AWS DynamoDB service.

AWS Instance IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role Name
AWS Instance IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
AWS Instance IAM Role.tooltip: Specify the IAM Role of your AWS instance that you need to access the AWS DynamoDB service.
AWS Instance IAM Role.description: Specify the IAM Role of your AWS instance that you need to access the AWS DynamoDB service.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: Specify the AWS region of your account required to access the AWS DynamoDB service.
Access Credentials.description: Specify the AWS region of your account required to access the AWS DynamoDB service.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Specify the AWS Access Key's ID required to access the AWS DynamoDB service.
Access Credentials.description: Specify the AWS Access Key's ID required to access the AWS DynamoDB service.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Specify the AWS Secret Access Key required to access the AWS DynamoDB Log service.
Access Credentials.description: Specify the AWS Secret Access Key required to access the AWS DynamoDB Log service.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. 
By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Table
operations.description: Creates a new table in AWS DynamoDB based on the table name, Partition Key Name, and other attributes you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type.
parameters.description:
Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type in Configuration Parameters. Enabling this option makes the following parameters mandatory: 

AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB 

Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. 

Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS. 

If you have specified Access Credentials as the configuration type, then enabling this parameter is optional.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: Specify a name for the table to create in AWS DynamoDB. A table name should have 3 to 255 characters and must contain only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.).
parameters.tooltip: A table name should have 3 to 255 characters and must contain only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.).
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Partition Key Name
parameters.description: Specify a name of the partition key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive. A partition key is a part of the table's primary key. It is a hash value that is used to retrieve items from a table and allocate data across hosts for scalability and availability.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a name of the partition key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive.
parameters.name: partitionKeyName

parameters.title: Partition Key Data Type
parameters.description:
Select a data type for the partition key from the following options:  

String 

Binary 

Number
parameters.tooltip: Select a data type for the partition key from the following options
parameters.name: partitionKeyDataType

parameters.title: Sort Key (Optional)
parameters.description: Specify the sort key for this table.The sort key is the second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sort key for this table.The sort key is the second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.name: sortKey

true.title: Sort Key Name
true.description: Specify a name for the sort key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive.
true.tooltip: Specify a name for the sort key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive.
true.name: sortKeyName

true.title: Sort Key Data Type
true.description:
Select a data type for the sort key from the following options:  

String 

Binary 

Number
true.tooltip: Select a data type for the sort key from the following options
true.name: sortKeyDataType

parameters.title: Billing Mode
parameters.description: Select a billing mode from the following options. Billing mode controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.
parameters.tooltip: Select 'Provisioned' mode for predictable workloads or Select 'On Demand' for unpredictable workloads.
parameters.name: billingMode

Provisioned.title: Read Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: readCapacityUnits

Provisioned.title: Write Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: writeCapacityUnits

operations.title: Delete Table
operations.description: Deletes an existing table from AWS DynamoDB based on the table name that you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type.
parameters.description:
Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type in Configuration Parameters. Enabling this option makes the following parameters mandatory: 

AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB 

Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. 

Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS. 

If you have specified Access Credentials as the configuration type, then enabling this parameter is optional.

parameters.description: Specify the name of the table to delete from AWS DynamoDB.

operations.title: Update Table
operations.description: Updates an existing table in AWS DynamoDB based on the table name, operation, and other attributes you have specified.

parameters.name: assume_role

parameters.description: Specify a name for the table to update in AWS DynamoDB.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a name for the table to update in AWS DynamoDB.
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Operation
parameters.description: Select the update operation to be performed on the specified table
parameters.tooltip: Select the update operation to be performed on the specified table from the following options
parameters.name: updateOperation
options: Create a New Global Secondary Index

Modify Provisioned Throughput.title: Billing Mode
Modify Provisioned Throughput.description: Select this option to modify the provisioned throughput and select the billing mode. Billing mode controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.
Modify Provisioned Throughput.tooltip: Select 'Provisioned' mode for predictable workloads or Select 'On Demand' for unpredictable workloads.
Modify Provisioned Throughput.name: billingMode

Provisioned.title: Read Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: readCapacityUnits

Provisioned.title: Write Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: writeCapacityUnits

Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.title: Stream Status
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.description: Select this option to enable or disable streams on DynamoDB. Streams are logs that capture changes to a DynamoDB table.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.tooltip: Select this option to enable or disable streams on DynamoDB.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.name: streamEnabled

Enable.title: Stream View Type
Enable.description: Stream View Type captures item-level changes in your table, and determines the information to write to a DynamoDB stream.
Enable.tooltip: Stream View Type captures item-level changes in your table, and determines the information to write to a DynamoDB stream.
Enable.name: streamViewType

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Index Name
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: Specify a name for the secondary index to create in AWS DynamoDB. The name should have 3 to 255 characters and must contain only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.).
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: A index name should should have 3 to 255 characters and must contain only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.).
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: indexName

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Partition Key Name
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: Specify a name of the partition key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive. A partition key is a part of the table's primary key. It is a hash value that is used to retrieve items from a table and allocate data across hosts for scalability and availability.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: A partition key is a part of the table's primary key. Specify a name of the partition key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: partitionKeyName

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Partition Key Data Type
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description:
Select a data type for the partition key from the following options:  

String 

Binary 

Number
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: Select a data type for the partition key from the following options
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: partitionKeyDataType

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Sort Key (Optional)
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description:
Specify the sort key for this table.The sort key is the second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key. If you enable this option, then specify the following options:  

Sort Key Name: Specify a name for the sort key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive. 

Sort Key Data Type: Select a data type for the sort key from the following options:  

String 

Binary 

Number
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: Specify the sort key for this table.The sort key is the second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: sortKey

Include.title: Attribute Name
Include.description: Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index.
Include.tooltip: Provide non-key attribute names in list or csv format.

Update a Global Secondary Index.title: Index Name
Update a Global Secondary Index.description: Specify the name of the existing secondary index to update in AWS DynamoDB.

operations.title: Get Table List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all existing tables from AWS DynamoDB.

operations.title: Create or Update Table Item
operations.description: Creates a new or updates an existing item in an AWS DynamoDB table based on the table name, partition key name, and other attributes you have specified.

parameters.description: Specify the name of the table in which to create a new item or update an existing table item.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the table in which to create a new item or update an existing table item.

parameters.title: Partition Key Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the partition key.

String 

Binary

parameters.title: Partition Key Value
parameters.description: Specify a value of the partition key to create the item or to update an existing item.

parameters.title: Sort Key (Optional)
parameters.description:
Specify the sort key for this table.The sort key is the second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key. If you enable this option, then specify the following options:  

Sort Key Name: Specify a name for the sort key. It must contain 1 to 255 characters and is case-sensitive. 

Sort Key Data Type: Select a data type for the sort key from the following options:  

String 

Binary 

Number
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sort key for this table
parameters.name: sortKey

true.tooltip: Specify the value of the sort key.
true.name: sortKeyValue

operations.title: Get Table Items List
operations.description: Retrieves the items of a AWS DynamoDB table based on the table name and selected attributes you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type.
parameters.description:
Select this checkbox if you have specified IAM Role as the configuration type in Configuration Parameters. Enabling this option makes the following parameters mandatory: 

AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB 

Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. 

Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS. 

If you have specified Access Credentials as the configuration type, then enabling this parameter is optional.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the table to fetch its table items.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the table to fetch its table items.
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Select Attributes
parameters.description:
Specify the table attributes (columns) to be returned in the result. Select from the following options:  

ALL_ATTRIBUTES: Select this option to get table items with all the columns. 

ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES: Select this option to get table items with all the columns mentioned in the secondary index of the table you specify (global or local).  

Index Name: Specify the name of the secondary index to scan for attributes. 

SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES: Select this option to get table items for the attributes specified in the following field:  

Projection Expression: Specify a comma-separated list of columns for the table items.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the table attributes (columns) to be returned in the result.
parameters.name: Select

ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES.title: Index Name
ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES.description: The name of a secondary index to scan. This index can be any local secondary index or global secondary index.
ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES.tooltip: The name of a secondary index to scan. This index can be any local secondary index or global secondary index.
ALL_PROJECTED_ATTRIBUTES.name: IndexName

SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES.title: Projection Expression
SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES.description: A string that identifies one or more attributes to retrieve from the specified table or index.
SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES.tooltip: Provide comma separated names of table columns you want to display
SPECIFIC_ATTRIBUTES.name: ProjectionExpression

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of items to get in the resulting output.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of items to get in the resulting output.
parameters.name: Limit

operations.title: Create Global Table
operations.description:
Creates a global table from an existing table. This operation only applies to global table version 2017.11.29. Before creating a global table ensure that the existing table meets the following conditions:  

The table must be empty. 

A Log stream of type New and Old Images must be enabled for this table.

Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS. 

If you have specified Access Credentials as the configuration type, then enabling this parameter is optional.
